FacilityName: Helena Chemical Company - Albion, NE Retail

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The Helena Chemical Company (Helena) Albion Facility has submitted this updated electronic RMP in compliance with the provisions of the Clean Air Act 112 (r) as codified by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency at 40 CFR Part 68. Standards codified by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration at 29 CFR 1910.119 are not applicable to the operations at this facility because the facility is operated as a retail operation and is exempt from the OSHA standards. This electronic submittal provides conservative estimates of the offsite consequences of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia from the Albion Facility located at 2493 State Highway 14, Albion, NE 68620.  The electronic RMP summarizes the policies and procedures implemented by the Albion Facility to minimize the likelihood of an accident.  The electronic RMP also summarizes the actions that the Albion Facility has taken to ensure that a response to a release (even though a release is unlikely) will be implemented in a proper and timely manner.

PURPOSE FOR UPDATING RMP

Helena has updated this RMP as required by the 5-Year update.  Since the last submittal in 2005, Helena has reduced its inventory as it no longer receives anhydrous ammonia by railcar.  Therefore, the largest single vessel used in the OCA is now an 18,000-gallon storage tank.  This 5-year update includes a revised off-site consequence analysis for the worst case and alternative case scenario to reflect the largest single vessel.  There have been no changes in the receptors since the last submittal.  

FACILITY

The Albion Facility is a retail agricultural chemical facility.  Anhydrous ammonia is transported to the Facility via a Commercial Truck and it is off-loaded into the on-site 18,000-gallon storage tank.  The commercial operator is responsible for the maintenance and operation of the Commercial Truck.  Helena conducts transfer operations of the anhydrous ammonia from the on-site storage tank to the nurse tan

ks.  The Independent Contractor transfers the anhydrous ammonia from the on-site storage tank and batch processes the material through a reactor.  The independent contractor performs the batch reactor operations using a mobile pipe reactor.  The batch operations consist of unloading the anhydrous ammonia from the on-site storage tank into the reactor and mixing it with water and phosphoric acid to produce ammonium phosphate fertilizer.  The contractor is responsible to OSHA for Process Safety Management compliance. Helena Chemical Company does not own or operate the formulation processes at the facility.
 
OFF-SITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS

Worst case and alternative consequence analysis were completed for the ammonia storage process. The worst case scenario release for the Albion Facility assumed that all the contents in the largest single storage tank were released.  The release was modeled as if the ammonia tank was punctured on the side at the ground level. The resulting release of ammonia was modeled as a ground level horizontal jet.

The alternative (or more likely to occur) scenario assumes a rupture of a 1.5-inch line caused by an impact from a vehicle or some other source on the liquid ammonia transfer line during a major loading or unloading operation.  Although this event is classified as an alternative scenario, even an accident of this type is unlikely to occur due to the safety equipment and operating procedures that Helena uses to safeguard ammonia transfer operations.

ACCIDENT PREVENTION PROGRAM

The Operations Manager implements the risk management planning process at this Helena facility.  The Operations Manager is assisted by other Helena staff, as directed.  The fertilizer handling process is implemented by an Independent Contractor.  

To ensure that its contractor is responsible to Helena for complying with relevant operation, maintenance, training procedures and documentation, the contractor must, at a minimum:

?    Have in place and certify compli

ance with an OSHA Process Safety Management Plan (PSM);
?    Make available to Helena and EPA upon request, any documentation necessary to comply with the PSM;
?    Review, certify and comply with Helena?s emergency shut-down procedures for ammonia unloading, and emergency notification and evaluation procedures.

All of Helena?s contractors subject to this standard will be required to acknowledge and sign an Independent Contractor Certification Statement.  Helena will provide a copy of its Contingency Plan and Operating Procedures to its contractors for review and implementation.  A copy of the Helena RMP will be available for the independent contractor?s review at the Helena facility.  Helena personnel are responsible for providing notification to the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and Fire Department when its' contractor intends to operate the reactor.
 
EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Helena Chemical Company?s Albion Facility is a non-responding facility. Helena has coordinated emergency response activities with its local emergency response agency and local fire department.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no on-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage; or off-site deaths, injuries, property damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place, in the past five (5) years because of the ammonia operations at the Albion Facility.

CONCLUSION

The Risk Management Plan implemented by Helena Chemical Company at the Albion Facility complies with the requirements of the Clean Air Act, Section 112(r). The RMP will be updated as the Albion Facility adds, deletes, or changes processes. The Emergency Response Program has been coordinated with the Boone County LEPC.

NOTE: Sections 4, 5, 6, and 7 of the standard RMP produced by EPA?s RMP Submit Program are not applicable to the Albion Facility.
